Title: Vase
Medium: brass, inlaid with silver and black filler or composition (bituminous?)
Inscriptions: [Translation] on neck: Glory, prosperity, wealth, contentment, glory, [Muhammad's intercession], favor and long life, perpetual; [Translation] On body: Victory, blessing, ascendancy, well-being, prosperity, ?, ?, gratitude, perpetuity, ?, Muhammad's intercession and long life always.
Description: The decoration here features the signs of the zodiac, including Leo and Gemini on either side of Cancer.
Provenance: Peytel Collection, Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Iranian
Images: PL7_54.453A_NF_H48-tms.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetA_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetB_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetC_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetD_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetE_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetF_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetG_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.453_DetH_DD_T11.jpg, PS1
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Third Floor: Islamic Art
